video.title: Velocity of Money Rather than Quantity Driving Prices
video.description: How velocity of money can drive price increases.

problemSets.question: What does “high velocity of money” represent?

choices.answer: Movement of large amounts of money.
A large number of transactions (i.e. money moves quickly).

problemSets.question: What is the difference between price changes driven by quantity of money, and those driven by velocity of money?

choices.answer: Quantity refers to the price changes caused by the amount of demand for money, while velocity refers to price changes caused by many transactions.
Quantity refers to the price changes caused by the amount of money in circulation, while velocity refers to price changes caused by many transactions.
Quantity refers to the price changes caused by the amount of money in circulation, while velocity refers to price changes caused by the movement of large amounts of money.
